Friday, May 25, 2007























 Diabetes drug Avandia linked to heart risks
A widely used diabetes pill raises the risk of heart attacks and possibly death, according to a scientific analysis that reveals what some experts are calling another Vioxx-like example of the government failing to protect the public from an unsafe drug.
FULL STORY




















Study: Smoking forbidden in most U.S. homes
Smoking is forbidden in nearly three out of four U.S. households, a dramatic increase from the 43 percent of homes that prohibited smoking a decade ago, the government reports.
FULL STORY






FDA OKs birth-control pill that ends periods 
The first birth-control pill meant to put a stop to women's monthly periods indefinitely won federal approval Tuesday. Called Lybrel, it's the first such pill to receive approval for continuous use.
FULL STORY






Weight-loss drug pitch stresses diet, exercise
You will not lose weight in your sleep or shed pounds  while eating anything you want -- that's the sobering message from the maker of a weight loss pill poised to hit shelves next month.
FULL STORY






Vitamin use may be linked to advanced prostate cancer
A new study suggests high-dose multivitamins may harm the prostate, the latest among confusing reports on whether vitamins really help a variety of conditions or are harmful.
